event.name: FINISH_BEACON_UNEXPLORED

beaconType.visitedTooltip: This is the exit beacon. Go here to travel to the next sector.

event.text: You've discovered the exit beacon out of the sector. Once the FTL drive is charged you'll be able to leave this sector.

event.name: NEBULA_FINISH_BEACON_UNEXPLORED

beaconType.visitedTooltip: This is the exit beacon. Go here to travel to the next sector.

event.text: You've discovered the exit beacon out of the sector. Once the FTL drive is charged you'll be able to leave this sector.

event.name: UNEXPLORED_FRONTIER
event.text: A slightly worn down Union ship waits here. "Howdy, Renegade. We frontiersmen have been looking to settle on a quiet world far away from the war. We don't got a sophisticated sensor system like your fancy cruisers do, and our weapons aren't much to look at. We were hoping to settle a world 'round these parts... but as we got closer we thought we might have seen signs o' one of them pirates. D'ya reckon you could go check to see if it's safe?"

choice.text: (Upg. Sensors) Use your advanced sensors to get a detailed reading.
(Long-Ranged Scanners) Use your scanners to get a detailed reading.
Agree to go investigate the area.

event.text: You decide to prey upon the ship. Since you're so far out and they're cut off from civilization, this action won't likely harm your reputation.

choice.text: Leave them to their own devices.

event.text: The voice on the other end mutters. "Can't depend upon anybody, I s'pose..."

event.name: UNEXPLORED_FRONTIER_SMUGGLER
event.text: A smuggler is situated in orbit around a nearby planet. As you draw close, they hail you. "You lookin' to do business, or make trouble?"
You make your answer clear by warming your weapons. "Trouble it is."

choice.text: Tell them about the settlers to gauge their reaction.

event.text: "Look, pal. We're just passing through. We have more important things to do than yanking some banjos away from hillbillies. Now do you want to buy something or not?"

choice.text: Buy a weapon from the smuggler.

event.text: Pleasure doin' business with ya, pal. I got some more stuff if you want to see it.

After you finish shopping, you return to the settlers to report on the situation. "...it was just a passin' smuggler? You're sure...? Well, I'm not going to argue with you, I guess. If they turn on us then that's on you, buddy."
"...it was just a passin' smuggler? You're sure...? Well, if you say so, I s'pose. If they turn on us then that's on you, partner."

choice.text: Tell them about the settlers to gauge their reaction.

event.text: "Yeah, so? Why should we care? Eye up our paint, buddy. We smugglers avoid drawing attention to ourselves." At this moment, you become aware that the planet the ship is in orbit around has a small hideout. "They wanna be our neighbors? We'll be quiet if they will. Now do you want to buy something or not?"

choice.text: Buy a weapon from the smuggler.

event.text: Pleasure doin' business with ya, pal. I got some more stuff if you want to see it.

After you finish shopping, you return to the settlers to report on the situation. "...A den o' smugglers? Well... that's a darn shame, but if ya'll are sayin' they're no threat, then we'll give 'er a go. If they turn on us then that's on you, partner."
"...A den o' smugglers? Well... that's a darn shame, but if ya'll are sayin' they're no threat, then we'll give 'er a go. If they turn on us then that's on you, partner."

event.name: UNEXPLORED_FRONTIER_SLAVER
event.text: Looks like a slaver is here. They're not immediately hostile, but if they remain in the area, the settlers will be captured.
The settlers will likely want them dead - and you're willing to help them out.

choice.text: Tip them off about the settlers, for a price.

event.text: You offer to sell them the location of a helpless ship. "Not bad, they should be ripe for the plundering. Here's your commission." After paying you, the slavers take off to harvest their prey.

choice.text: Leave them and report on your findings.

event.text: "...So there was a ship? And you didn't manage to destroy them? That's a pity... I guess we will look elsewhere for our settlement. This will be dangerous."

event.name: UNEXPLORED_FRONTIER_VAGABOND
event.text: At first, the "evidence of pirates" appears to be little more than debris from a wreck. However, once you get closer, it comes to life. It's a Vagabond ship, and they're hailing you. "For what purpose do you intrude upon our domain?"
No need to overcomplicate this, these Ghosts might pose a threat to the settlers.

choice.text: Ask them if the settlers can live on this planet.

event.text: "Wherefore this planetary body, far beyond any civilization?" You tell them that's why they want to come. "Truly, their actions are commendable. We had not taken action to settle this territory yet... perhaps, we may join them?"
"Vagabonds? Wantin' to help? My stars, things might be goin' our way after all!" The ship departs for the planet that they had come to settle.

choice.text: Ask them if the settlers can live on this planet.

event.text: "We have already claimed this territory! ...yet, there is no edict that decrees we cannot share. It is fine! They may come." You tell them that's why they want to come. "To strive through thine own means... Such wisdom. We are akin. We grant them sanctuary."
"Vagabonds? Offerin' us some good ol' fashioned hospitality? Things might be goin' our way after all!" The ship departs for the planet that they had come to settle.

event.name: UNEXPLORED_FRONTIER_OTHER_SETTLE_LOCATION
event.text: Instead of exploring the system, you use the data you've collected on the sector to find the absolute best place for the settlers to settle. Not only are you able to find a garden world and a perfect path to get them there, but doing so will also save them supplies due to the superior climate of the new planet you've found. "My stars! You've found an even better planet fer us? Yer a legend! I reckon we owe you a little more gratitude than we're capable of givin'!" As they said, they give you all that they can.

event.name: UNEXPLORED_PIRATE_INVESTIGATE_NONE
event.text: You can tell that there is no pirate ships in the area. Not only that, but the data that you gather shows that there is a string of debris - and using your computer's extrapolation, you manage to discover a large bounty of debris! You can scrap this once you're done helping the settlers.

choice.text: Collect data on the planet's surface.

event.text: It seems like the planet itself is safe too. With all this information at your fingertips, you send them all the data that you've collected. "Mighty kind o' you to go the extra mile, there pardner! This place seems ideal for settlin'. Here's a little something for your trouble."

choice.text: Collect data on the planet's surface.

event.text: As it happens, there are already settlers on this planet, who seem to have had a similar idea. The settlement seems entirely peaceful. You send this data to the settlers who have contacted you. "Boy howdy, I wasn't 'specting such a turn o' events. Still, I'd reckon a whole planet's big enough fer the two 'a us. Thanks a bundle."

event.name: UNEXPLORED_PIRATE_INVESTIGATE_SMUGGLER
event.text: Your ship's readings say that there is a smuggler at this location.

choice.text: Collect data on the planet's surface.

event.text: Although there is a smuggler, they are alone, and likely only in the area for a short time.

choice.text: Spend time using your map data to find a better place for them to settle.
Collect data on the planet's surface.

event.text: The planet the smuggler is in orbit around has a smuggler's hideaway. Even if the ship is destroyed, the smugglers will still maintain a presence in the area.

choice.text: Spend time using your map data to find a better place for them to settle.

event.name: UNEXPLORED_PIRATE_INVESTIGATE_SLAVER
event.text: Your ship's readings say that there is a slaver at this location.

choice.text: Collect data on the planet's surface.

event.text: Although there is a slaver, they are alone, and likely only in the area for a short time.

choice.text: Spend time using your map data to find a better place for them to settle.
Collect data on the planet's surface.

event.text: The planet the slaver is in orbit around has a slaver's hideaway. Even if the ship is destroyed, the smugglers will still maintain a presence in the area.

choice.text: Spend time using your map data to find a better place for them to settle.

event.name: UNEXPLORED_PIRATE_INVESTIGATE_VAGABOND
event.text: Your ship's readings say that there is a ship wreck occupied by Vagabond Ghosts at this location.

choice.text: Collect data on the planet's surface.

event.text: The Vagabond ship is the only sign of intelligent life in the sector, however.

choice.text: Spend time using your map data to find a better place for them to settle.
Collect data on the planet's surface.

event.text: The Vagabonds seem to be settling the planet's surface.

choice.text: Spend time using your map data to find a better place for them to settle.

event.name: UNEXPLORED_VAGABOND_AFTERMATH
event.text: "Vagabonds? That don't bother me one bit. I ain't 'fraid of no ghosts!"

event.name: UNEXPLORED_FRONTIER_NONE
event.text: The "evidence of pirates" appears to be little more than debris from a wreck long past. While the quality has degraded, it's still scrap that you can harvest.
"There weren't no pirates? Just flotsam? Whew! We'll begin settlin' immediately. Here's a reward for your efforts." The ship departs for the planet that they had come to settle.

event.name: UNEXPLORED_PIRATE_NO_SETTLEMENT_AFTERMATH
event.text: After disposing of the pirate and dispatching their ship, the area is clear. There is no pirate hideaway here - This should answer any follow up questions the Frontiersman has.
"So there WAS a pirate. Thanks for handling them for us. Hopefully none o' their friends come looking for them..."

event.name: UNEXPLORED_PIRATE_SETTLEMENT_AFTERMATH
event.text: After disposing of the pirate and dispatching their ship, you find the hideaway that the pirates had been staying at. This area is likely too dangerous to settle, especially after you just killed one of them.
"A pirate hideout...? All the good planets done been scooped up already, I reckon. Back to the drawin' board..."

event.name: UNEXPLORED_ORCHID
event.text: An Orchid ship resides here. "Renegade! We need you to help us out. One of our people went missing in this nebula. We Orchids don't like nebulas very much, that's why we're taking a break out here. Sure, some of us are willing to put in the work to explore them, but we need to photosynthesize, and nebulas tend to get in the way. Anyway, you'll be able to search it much faster than we can. Think you can help us out?"

choice.text: Tell them you'll keep an eye out.

event.text: "Thank you! Here is the data you need on the missing person. Once you zero in on the target, we'll meet you there!"
The Orchids frantically turn their comms off as you attack them.

choice.text: Tell them there isn't much you can do for them.

event.text: "We understand."

event.name: UNEXPLORED_ORCHID_FOUND_AUTO_DESTROYED
event.text: "You... you can't make me go back! They... they'll never accept me once they find out the truth!" The Orchid sighs. "I... I tried a human salad. And... it was good. Carrots. Lettuce. Tomatoes... They're tasty... and so I kept eating them... And then I got to wondering... how the plants on Rt'lak Et tasted..." The Orchid shivers. "They'll find out what I've done! I can't go back!"

You hold the Orchid until the ship comes back. As the other Orchid ship comes in, they notice the destroyed Auto-ship. "What happened here...? Clearly we will have to look into this further. Thank you for helping us find the missing person. Here's the other half of your reward!"

choice.text: Offer sanctuary and leave before the Orchids arrive.

event.text: "Really? We'd better get out of here fast. Please avoid Gathering space if you can!"

event.name: NEBULA_UNEXPLORED_ORCHID_QUEST

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: According to your readouts, the missing Orchid may be at this location.

event.text: Your ship tells you that you've found the location of the missing person. A lone Orchid hails you. "Dammit! I've been found! Leave me alone!" As he screams at you, a Federation Auto-ship attacks you, as if to keep you away!

event.name: UNEXPLORED_SEPARATIST_ONLY
event.text: The binary stars that this beacon orbits around have no natural satellites. No planets, no asteroids, nothing. However, there is a single Separatist ship.

You hail the Separatist. They reply somewhat gruffly. "The Harmony hasn't -looked- in this region. Just want to be [left] alone. These stars... remind of -something-. Something better." The Separatist pauses and then repeats. "Something -better-..." After a few moments the Separatist speaks up again. "Do you have [anything] destructive that might aid -seclusion-?"

choice.text: (Beacon Eater) Offer to eat the beacon to ensure their privacy.

event.text: "Impressive, never even considered it. Please, -demonstrate-." The Beacon Eater devours the beacon, devouring enough of it that any further damage will collapse it. "My freedom is finally [assured]...? It seems unbelievable. Please, take this gift. I will -finish- the job after you leave... eventually. Might look around the sector one last time before I do."

choice.text: (Mine Launcher) Offer to lay mines to protect from the Harmony.

event.text: "Agreed. Show me how you plan to do this." You deploy your Mine Launcher to wall off the beacon such that any attempt to stray from the beacon will damage a ship, leaving just enough of a gap to slip through before finishing the job - you would prefer to take a reward after all.
"This should be effective. I hope this reward is suitable." Once they give you their material reward, you finish the mining job. Time to move on.
"Appreciated. Can -program- drone to deliver Magnetic [Payload] directly to Harmony vessels." The Separatist trades you an ion weapon, and gives a small tip as well.
"Appreciated. Though, it will take work."
The ship begins to take evasive maneuvers. It seems ready to fight!
The solitary other ship makes no moves, providing an opportunity to do something on your ship.
The ship begins to take evasive maneuvers. It seems ready to fight!
The solitary other ship makes no moves, providing an opportunity to do something on your ship.

event.name: UNEXPLORED_MAROONED_OUTCASTS
event.text: A nearby unsettled planet has a crash site. It seems to have been a Theocracy Jailer.

Going down to the crash site, you find a small encampment of outcasts. Upon learning you are not affiliated with the Theocracy, they invite you to have a meal with them. Their leader speaks up. "We crashed this ship onto this world a few months ago, and they haven't come 'round. We don't even know if they were looking for us. We're just happy to be free." He pauses. "However, since you are able to find us, this means we might be discovered some day. We either need to find out what's wrong with the cloaking device that we salvaged from the ship, or we need some munitions."

choice.text: (Cloaking) Let them look at your working cloaking device.

event.text: You show them your cloaking system, and using it as a reference point, your crew and their encampment are able to fix up their broken cloaking device. "Amazing! Now we can hide ourselves whenever they come near. We'll give you something that we set aside in case we had to fight."

choice.text: Offer them a large stockpile of munitions. [-15}]

event.text: The village head is pleased. "Thank you, we will make good use of this." They reward you with some of the scrap that had been left over from the crash and a derelict weapon they can no longer use.

choice.text: (Explosive Replicator) Synthesize a stockpile of munitions. [-7}]

event.text: The village head is pleased. "Thank you, we will make good use of this." They reward you with some of the scrap that had been left over from the crash and a derelict weapon they can no longer use.

choice.text: Offer them passage on your ship.

event.text: The outcasts seem to be attached to this land they've been working on, but they relent and decide to take passage on your ship and get off at the next neutral station. One of them decides that the safest place would be on your crew.
"So there is nothing you can do? Well, we have time. Hopefully we can prepare for the Theocracy in some way or another."
You take this opportunity to rest.

event.name: NEBULA_FEDERATION_GIFT
event.text: A Federation ship is exploring the nebula here. "A friendly face? It's dangerous to go alone! Take this!" The nearby Federation vessel dispenses a weapon for your aid.

choice.text: Thank them and do something aboard the ship.

event.text: You thank the Federation ship and move your new weapon into the cargo.
You power up your weapons and prepare to engage the ship.

event.name: NEBULA_NEW_PLANET
event.text: To your surprise, there is no nebula at this beacon at all. The beacon appears to be freshly made, and the people who placed it here likely made a mistake with labeling it. In the distance is a large, unexplored and unpopulated planet, suggesting this location is desired for colonization.

You pull closer to the surface of the planet, revealing a few distinct features. A large ravine running along the planet's surface, a crater along with the asteroid responsible for it, and an expansive flat region with few noticeable landmarks, at least not from this high up.

You can officially add spelunking to the list of things you didn't expect to be doing on this mission. The trip goes smoothly, and on your way you encounter several valuable looking gems which you'll no doubt be able to make some scrap off of.
The asteroid left a considerable amount of rubble in its wake, and large portions of harvestable material have been exposed. You'll be able to refine this into fuel back on the ship.
After some exploring it becomes clear that you aren't the first ship to have explored this planet. A ship has crashed here, and the survivor is thankful for you rescuing them.
You'll leave the exploration to people with with more time on their hands. Who makes these beacons anyways?

event.name: NEBULA_SIGNAL
event.text: This beacon appears to be empty, but you're detecting a very weak, looping encrypted signal from in the nebula.

choice.text: (Slug Crew) Have your Slug decode the signal.

event.text: The signal is difficult to decode, but you're able to break it. It appears to be the location for a pirate cache on a nearby planet!

choice.text: (Telepathic Shell) Have your Shell decode the signal.

event.text: The signal is difficult to decode, but you're able to break it. It appears to be the location for a pirate cache on a nearby planet!

choice.text: (Cognitive Crew) Have your Cognitive decode the signal.

event.text: The signal is difficult to decode, but you're able to break it. It appears to be the location for a pirate cache on a nearby planet!
You don't have time to try and figure out this signal.
The signal is very hard to decode. You're forced to give up or risk wasting too much time.
The signal is very hard to decode. You're forced to give up or risk wasting too much time.
The signal is difficult to decode, but you're able to break it. It appears to be the location for a pirate cache on a nearby planet!
You search for a long time, but you only end up getting lost in the nebula. This has been a large waste of time.

You find the ship emitting the signal, an emptied pirate ship. Now that you know the origins of the signal, you're able to easily decode the signal. It appears to be the location for a pirate cache on a nearby planet!

event.name: NEBULA_SIGNAL_QUEST
event.text: The cache is filled with supplies and even a brand new weapon! Unfortunately, it seems another pirate vessel has also come looking for the cache. A fight is unavoidable.

event.name: NEBULA_TRADER
event.text: It's hard to see why, but this beacon is apparently a tourist destination. One of the ships at the small station is offering a deal.
You have no need for their services.

event.name: NEBULA_LIGHT_PIRATE_STATION
event.text: The nebula at this beacon is thinner than usual. A pirate station is operating nearby, though it doesn't appear to receive much business.
The pirates show you several crates of supplies that they are offering.
This station is run by filthy pirates and was likely stolen. You'll be doing justice by killing them.
Whatever illegal services the pirates could offer, you aren't interested.

event.name: NEBULA_STORM_PLATFORM
event.text: Nearby lies a dormant Slug cealaforming station. They must have been harvesting the nebulous gases when the ion storm started, and have now taken refuge in the station. Next to it is a platform, unprotected.

choice.text: Raid the platform while the Slugs are hiding.
The storm is too much of a risk. Ignore the platform.

event.text: The Slugs are helpless at stopping you. You take all that you can from the platform.
The Slugs aren't interested in just letting you escape with their supplies. The station powers up its weapons and attacks!

event.name: NEBULA_STORM_ITEMS
event.text: You jump into the middle of a plasma storm. Multiple recently incapacitated ships loom in the shadows, briefly illuminated by the lightning.

choice.text: Manually search the wreckage for survivors and equipment.
You have no crew to send out to plunder any remains left.
Avoid the risk and wait to jump away unscathed.
(Upg. Piloting) Have your pilot carefully explore the debris.

event.text: Despite your caution, the lack of detection equipment allows debris to crash into your ship, damaging the hull. You salvage what you can and prepare to jump before anything worse happens.

Within the ship graveyard you find one ship that seems relatively untouched. On board you find an unconscious passenger, and take them back to the ship. Once awake they offer to join your crew in thanks.

While the crew is off the ship searching through the wrecks, two hulls crash into each other breaking the crew's tethers. You have no time to react as someone is knocked away, floating helplessly into the gaseous clouds...

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, your crewmember was close enough to the ship for the Clone Bay to revive them.

event.text: Among the junk and scrap you find a salvageable drone schematic. You decide to quit while ahead and prepare to jump with your recent find.
Most of the debris is hardly even usable as scrap. However, you eventually find an intact weapon that can be mounted on your ship.

Within the ship graveyard you find one ship that seems relatively untouched. On board you find an unconscious passenger and take him back to the ship. Once awake they offer to join your crew in thanks.
Among the junk and scrap you find a salvageable drone schematic. You decide to quit while ahead and prepare to jump with your recent find.
Most of the debris is hardly even usable as scrap. However, you eventually find an intact weapon that can be mounted on your ship.
Your pilot carefully explores the wrecks, but the storm has taken its toll. Any crew are long-since dead and the floating debris has been scorched beyond repair.

event.name: NEBULA_DUEL
event.text: There may not be sound in space, but the flashing from deep in the nebula suggest a battle is being raged, but you aren't sure by whom.
You aren't willing to take the risk to get involved in the conflict.
The two ships seem to have destroyed each other. This is fortunate for you, because now you have two wrecks to salvage.
A Mantis vessel stands victorious over its rival, a fellow Mantis ship. They aren't one to pass up another fight, so they immediately lock onto you and attack.
A Pirate vessel stands victorious over its rival, a Civilian ship. They aren't one to pass up another fight, so they immediately lock onto you and attack.
A Slug vessel stands victorious over its rival, a Rock ship. They aren't one to pass up another fight, so they immediately lock onto you and attack.
A Ghost vessel stands victorious over its rival, a Slug ship. They aren't one to pass up another fight, so they immediately lock onto you and attack.
A Duskbringer vessel stands victorious over its rival, a Zoltan ship. They aren't one to pass up another fight, so they immediately lock onto you and attack.

event.name: NEBULA_SLUG_HUNTER
event.text: A pirate ship hails you. "We have an offer for you, if you're interested in some scrap."
"This sector ain't a friendly place. You know why? Slugs. Filthy bastards, good for nothin' except making punching bags out of. Interested in killing some for us?"
"Excellent! Follow us..." They lead you to a nearby Slug ship. "Kill these ones, and you'll have an excellent reward awaiting you!"

choice.text: (Nights) "Good point! How about a gift, fellow hater?"

event.text: Nights' impersonation of a Rockman is pretty impressive. The pirates believe it. Shortly after you hear a sharp scream from their crew as the gift wrapped bomb he sent them explodes. They scramble to attack you.

choice.text: (Slocknog) Feign interest while Slocknog hails the Slugs.

event.text: "Excellent! Follow us..." They lead you to a nearby Slug ship. By the time you arrive, the Slug is ready for a fight. You have no difficulty flanking and destroying the pirates.

"Good looking out for usss, Ssslocknog."
Slocknog smiles. "We're on a sssensitive missssion. Would any of you like to help?"
A volunteer from the Slug ship agrees to accompany you.

Sylvan calmly, but menacingly offers to let them reconsider their words. "My god, you let one of th-"
A crewmate stops them. "Wait! Isn't that... Sylvan? The Merchant?" The bravado quickly fades from the pirates. "L-look! We didn't mean nothin' by it! We'll give you all we can spare! Just don't kill us!"
"No no no no!" The pirates panic at the prospect of having to fight Sylvan.

choice.text: (Irwin) "How 'bout a duel? Ten pacesss, turn and draw. Winner takessss all."

event.text:
The pirate grimaces. "Loath as I am to lay eyes on a Slug, if you want me to be the one that kills you, then I'll do it." Irwin and the pirate stand at either side of the airlocks connecting your ship. They take 10 steps and... "Draw!"
Irwin turns around, shooting the pirate before he can even get his gun up. He notices that the pirate behind him also draws his and shoots him as well. The rest of the pirates put their hands up, clearly defeated. You take what you can from their ship.

choice.text: (Billy) "I ssshould hire ssssomeone to kick your asss for that! Or better yet, I'll do it myssself!"

event.text: "Yuck, the only thing worse than a Slug is a rich Slug. You sicken me."

choice.text: (Slug Crew) "You talk a lot of trassssh for sssomeone in tentacle ssslapping dissssstance."

event.text: "My god, you let one of those filthy creatures live on your ship? You are disgraceful!"
You ignore the pirates.

event.name: NEBULA_SLUG_HUNTER_WIN
event.text: You've defeated the Slug vessel. The pirates wait for you to finish scrapping the ship.
"Good work, you have done this sector a great service. Your reward..."

event.name: NEBULA_WHALE
event.text: A large blip on the radar is detecting a massive ship moving around this nebula. Its giant size suggests it may even be a fleet ship.

You dive deeper into the nebula, and are swatted out of the way by a giant tail! Luckily no harm comes to the ship, but you're left in shock. The object you detected was no fleet ship at all, but rather a humongous space whale!

choice.text: Explore the insides of the whale.

event.text: Space whales are cool, but they aren't worth wasting any time on.
If a fleet ship is lost this far out in the nebula, it's very likely of Rebel design, and you should avoid it at all costs.

Luckily space whales are so large that you can easily explore inside them. The contents of their stomach are... concerning. Littered with debris and dead ships, you hastily collect some parts and leave before you can meet the same fate.

Luckily space whales are so large that you can easily explore inside them. It seems another ship is exploring this whale, or maybe they're just a victim of the whale's immense appetite, but a nasty pirate ship locks onto you and attacks!

event.name: NEBULA_MINE_WRECK
event.text: The husk of an emptied Trapper vessel drifts into the nebula. Around it lays a few mines, but it's hard to tell whether they're still active.
Scrapping the wreck isn't worth accidentally activating the mines. You move on.
The mines were active after all! They lock onto your hull and move in, causing damage to your ship's integrity. You pull out before more damage can be done.
Luckily the mines are inactive and the Trapper remains unresponsive. You salvage some missiles and a Mine Launcher.
It appears you were mistaken about the Trapper being empty. The ship activates as you move in, and seeing your intentions as hostile they attack!

event.name: NEBULA_REBEL_UNDETECTED_MV
event.text: Your ship emerges quite far away from the beacon. You see a Rebel ship waiting nearby, undoubtedly stationed to look for you.
You raise your weapons and engage the Rebel ship.
You use your cloaking system to slip further into the nebula undetected.
You immediately slip further into the clouds, but not quickly enough. The Rebel catches sight of you and moves in to engage!
You arm the weapons and prepare to fight the Rebel ship.

choice.text: (Upg. Engines) Fully power the engines to out-run them.

event.text: Your powerful engines allow you to out-distance the ship and eventually lose it within the nebula.
You power down non-essential systems and slip into the cloud. The ship never noticed you.
The ship spots you and gives chase. After some quick maneuvering you were able to lose your pursuers in the clouds. You expect they warned the fleet of your position, however.

event.name: NEBULA_PIRATE_SMUGGLE_MV
event.text: A smuggler ship arrives shortly after you. Judging from the fact that it is attempting to avoid your ship, you assume that it's trying to hide deeper in the nebula.
You power up your weapons and move in to engage.
It jumps away after a time.

choice.text: (Adv. Weapons) Activate your advanced weapons threateningly.

event.text: They hail you, "There's no need for aggression... Perhaps this would convince you to look the other way?"
You prepare to engage the Smugglers.

event.name: NEBULA_AUTO_DEFENSE_ITEM_MV
event.text: An advance Rebel automated ship remains stationed near a small Rebel space-station. However, without functioning sensors it is impossible to tell what is inside.

choice.text: Attack the automated ship to get to the station.

event.text: You prepare to engage the automated vessel.
You distance yourself from the ship.

choice.text: (Cloaking) Attempt to stealthily access the space station.
(Upg. Cloaking) Use your stealth to access the space station.

event.text: You successfully sneak by the ship and access the station undetected.

choice.text: (Hacking) Try to hack the station to prevent an alert.
(Upg. Hacking) Hack the station to prevent an alert.

event.text: You successfully hack into the station and sever the connection to the automated ship, accessing the station completely undetected.
You successfully sneak by the ship and access the station undetected.
You try to sneak past the automated ship but it quickly turns and attacks!
You successfully hack into the station and sever the connection to the automated ship. You access the station undetected.
You send a drone to hack the station but the automated ship notices and turns to attack!

event.name: NEBULA_LOST_SHIP_MV
event.text: A heavily damaged Federation ship is hiding in the nebula at this beacon. Before you have time to make contact with them, they fade into the nebula.

choice.text: Attempt to follow and help them.
Keep your position, they can handle themselves.

event.text: The ship never resurfaces, leaving you alone at the beacon.

choice.text: (Teleporter) Lock onto their life-signs with your teleporter.

event.text: You beam the Federation crew aboard. One gladly joins your crew, the rest wait to be dropped off at the next station.

choice.text: (Long-Ranged Scanners) Pump extra power into your sensors and try to track them.

event.text: Your search is hopeless. Your sensors can't pick up anything in the nebula.
While searching fruitlessly through the nebula, you stumble upon the Rebel ship which the Federation loyalists were likely hiding from. You prepare for a fight.
You get lucky and find them floating not too deep into the nebula. Thrilled to be found by friendlies, they come on board and abandon their wrecked ship.

Your local radar flickers, periodically showing signs of a large object in the clouds nearby. However it's enough to get coordinates and you find the ship... an empty hull, long since stripped of functioning components.
You follow the faint signatures and find them floating not too far away into the nebula. Thrilled to be found by friendlies, they come on board and abandon their wrecked ship.

event.name: NEBULA_ROCK_RACIST_MV
event.text: A Rock armoured transport nearby looks to have lost its bearings, but when you hail they grow suspicious: "Whatever life-form you are, we find you repugnant. We seek no aid. Leave. Now."
You prepare to fight.

choice.text: (Rock Crew) Offer to lead them out of the nebula.

event.text: The Rock grudgingly transfer control of their helm to you and you steer them to a thinner part of the nebula. They're not sure what to think, but transfer over some supplies all the same.

event.name: NEBULA_MANTIS_CHOICE_MV
event.text: Navigating the fog blind, you practically bump hulls with a Mantis ship. They hail you: "Pah! This transgression will be overlooked. Nebula, very dangerous. Next time, Feds all die."

choice.text: There won't be a next time. Open fire!

event.text: You prepare to fight.

choice.text: This place is dangerous enough. Move on.

event.text: The Mantis ship jumps away after a short time.

event.name: NEBULA_REBEL_CHASE_MV
event.text: You spot a Rebel ship in the nebula ahead and stay off their radar. Try to engage?
You try and stay out of sight. You doubt they saw you.

choice.text: (Adv. Sensors) Try to track them as you move to engage.

event.text: As soon as they see you they make a run for it. You squeeze what you can out of the malfunctioning sensors and are able to keep track of them long enough to get in firing range.

choice.text: (Long-Ranged Scanners) Try to track them as you move to engage.

event.text: As soon as they see you they make a run for it. You squeeze what you can out of the malfunctioning sensors and are able to keep track of them long enough to get in firing range.

choice.text: (Lifeform Scanner) Use their life signatures to follow.

event.text: Your augment's ability to keep track of their life signatures within the nebula proves useful. You catch up to the ship and prepare for a fight.
You follow their vapour trails and surf onto their six o'clock, weapons hot.
Without sensors you can't maintain a lock for long. The Rebels slip away.
You get disoriented in the nebula and lose your bearings completely. It takes some time to get back to the beacon. It's likely the fleet has had time to advance closer to your position.

event.name: NEBULA_WATER_PLANET
event.text: Through the clearing in the nebula here you can see a large water planet, from which there appears to be 10 separate distress calls. A large cubical structure can be seen from the planet's surface. It's inactive, and you can't tell what it is from this distance.

It appears that all of the distress beacons are originating from the same area, a large crater with a massive ship wreck. The structure you noticed earlier begins to unfold, revealing itself to be a large gun! You won't have much time until it starts firing on you, so you'll have to pull away now if you want to avoid damage.

choice.text: We can take a few hits, pull in closer to inspect the wreck.

event.text: While the giant cannon charges, you investigate the wreck. It's huge, probably the size of one of the Rebel fleet ships, if not a little bigger. Suddenly, a giant beam fires from the structure, tearing through the ship's engines! It's quite the scratch, but you'll be able to fix it.

choice.text: (Obelisk Crew) Your crew desperately needs to tell you something.

event.text: Your crew explains the structure on the planet below is a massive anti-aircraft gun meant to enforce a strict quarantine over the planet. Somehow it has remained functional for a millenia, and with their help you temporarily deactivate the artillery remotely so you can approach safely.
Something isn't right about this planet. You power up the engines and pull away.

event.name: WATER_PLANET_LAND
event.text: On the planet's surface you find a crashed life pod with an engineer inside, surprisingly still alive. Once they're stabilized, you figure you might as well investigate the area around while you wait.

event.name: WATER_PLANET_INVESTIGATE
event.text: A gigantic leviathan class creature patrols the waters around the wreckage, but you're able to sneak around it. Though most of the ship is on fire, you find a lot of fire extinguishers lying around, a tablet like device with sector maps, and a hangar bay with some mech suits.
You grab as many fire extinguishers as you can. It's definitely not what you expected, coming here, but you'll take it.
A female voice comes from the device, saying something about 'emergency mode', but you ignore it and download the data.

choice.text: Grab some scrap and parts from the hangar.

event.text: The suits are in disrepair, which is fortunate for you. You salvage as much as you can carry.

choice.text: (Adv. Weapons) Fire everything you have on the leviathan.

event.text: It's entirely pointless but cathartic as you unleash every weapon you have on the creature. Most of your shots miss or are rendered worthless by the water but you'd like to think you showed that fish who's boss.
With the creature out of the way what will you do next?
You grab as many fire extinguishers as you can. It's definitely not what you expected, coming here, but you'll take it.
A female voice comes from the device, saying something about 'emergency mode', but you ignore it and download the data.

choice.text: Grab some scrap and parts from the hangar.

event.text: The suits are in disrepair, which is fortunate for you. You salvage as much as you can carry.

event.name: NEBULA_DISTRESS_DEATH_BY_GAS
event.text: A civilian ship desperately hails you. "The space gas- gas too thick- oxygen system damaged- too much... gas..."

choice.text: Unfortunate for the civilians, but you cannot risk helping them, unless you can pinpoint their location.

event.text: Only one life signature is detected on board, but you beam them back with your teleporter. The civilian explains that an encounter with a pirate led to a breach in their life support and a technical malfunction. Nebulous gases were sucked into their ship and the crew all suffocated. Now that they are the only survivor and their ship is worthless, they offer to work aboard yours.

choice.text: (Lifeform Scanner) Lock onto the civilians and quickly rescue them.

event.text: It appears you're mostly too late, as only one life sign is detected. Still, you hurry to bring them back onto your ship. The civilian explains that an encounter with a pirate led to a breach in their life support and a technical malfunction. Nebulous gases were sucked into their ship and the crew all suffocated. Now that they are the only survivor and their ship is worthless, they offer to work aboard yours.

choice.text: (Anaerobic Crew) Send in your crew to help.

event.text: Without any fear of suffocation, you send in your anaerobic crew to assist. The civilian explains that an encounter with a pirate led to a breach in their life support and a technical malfunction. Nebulous gases were sucked into their ship and the crew all suffocated. Now that they are the only survivor and their ship is worthless, they offer to work aboard yours.
You can't waste time helping the civilians. You move past them.

You dock with the civilians and board their ship to find the interior thick with nebulous gases. You rush to find any survivors, but it appears most did not make it. All of your crew manage to make their way back to the ship without further casualties.

The interior of the civilian ship is thick with nebulous gases, sucked into their ship by the faulty life support system. There doesn't appear to be any survivors, and when your crew arrive back to the ship one of them is missing. It's presumable that they were lost in the clouds and suffocated.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, regardless of whether your suspicions were correct, your crew is already in the process of being revived by the Clone Bay.

event.text: It seems a malfunction in the life support system, accompanied by a breach in the hull, led to the nebulous gases being sucked into the civilian vessel. Most of the crew appear to have already suffocated, but one survivor remains.

event.name: NEBULA_DISTRESS_SEARCH
event.text: The distress beacon here is emitting from a small ship requesting aid in finding someone.
You can't waste time helping the ship. You move past them.
The ship explains that they are a military vessel for the Federation. Their partner, a fellow military vessel, got lost in the nebula and hasn't returned. They request that you track down the ship.
It turns out the ship isn't far from your current location, but they're in trouble. They're under attack from a Rebel ship!

The ship appears to be an Engi escort. "Primary mission: protect high importance Zoltan shuttle. Failure. Ship is lost in nebula. Sensors non-functional. We offer scrap in return for favor - tracking lost ship."
It turns out the ship isn't far from your current location, but they're in trouble. A mercenary ship looking to take out the Zoltan has locked onto the shuttle and is barreling towards them!

The ship turns out to be a Federation science vessel. They were transporting a Federation Auto-Drone through this sector but the AI went faulty and the ship got lost in the nebula. They ask that you track it down.
It turns out the ship isn't far from your current location, but the Auto-ship is under attack by a Rebel Engineer looking to steal the tech for themselves!

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_REBEL_NEBULA
textList.text: You cross paths with an advance scout of the Rebel fleet searching this section of the nebula for your ship.
A ship bearing Rebel colors can be seen waiting near the beacon. They must have been waiting for you, since they engage immediately.
The Rebels must have anticipated you would try to lose them within the nebula. A scout is waiting for you at the beacon.
It looks like you will be unable to avoid the Rebels by traveling through the nebula. A Rebel ship is waiting for you near the beacon.
Shortly after you arrive, a Rebel ship jumps nearby. There looks to be no escape. Prepare for a fight!
Newton-knows what brings this Rebel ship so far out; its captain hails, but does a double take when he identifies your ship. They open fire.
A Rebel ship hails, but you don't take chances in conditions like this. You block the frequency and prepare to engage.

event.name: NEBULA_ENCOUNTER_REBEL_LIGHTNEBULA
event.text: This beacon has a clearing from the nebula, revealing more of the distant space. However, it appears a Rebel ship has already arrived and is now approaching quickly!

event.name: NEBULA_STORM_REBEL
event.text: You arrive in the middle of a plasma storm. Despite the harsh conditions, a Rebel scout seems to be waiting for you.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_AUTO_NEBULA
textList.text: You cross paths with an advance scout of the Rebel fleet searching this section of the nebula for your ship.
You jump into a calmer part of the nebula. However, your relief fades as a Rebel scout jumps to the beacon and moves in to attack.
The tangled wrecks of many ships wait in dormancy here. You see lights flicker on what looks like debris. A Rebel scout bursts out of the wreckage!
This drone isn't looking for you. Perhaps it's scouting ahead for the Rebel expansion or maybe they're seeking to use this nebula for cover. Regardless, it identifies you as hostile.
It's worrying that the Rebels have penetrated so deep into uncharted space, even if it is only an unmanned craft. It arms its weapons; you should do the same.

event.name: NEBULA_STORM_AUTO
event.text: You jump into a sector of the nebula beset by a plasma storm. An automated Rebel ship stationed at the beacon moves in to attack.
You prepare for combat.
You successfully lose the ship in the storm.
By using your advanced cloaking system you easily lose your pursuer in the storm.
You successfully lose the ship in the storm.
Despite your advanced engines you are unable to shake them; you turn and prepare for a fight.

textList.name: NEBULA_PIRATE
textList.text: As you drift through the nebula an unmarked vessel descends from the clouds and into your wake. Their weapons come online.
A pirate ship pulls out of the ether and hails: "You know what I love about this part of the galaxy? The explorers! You always carry such fine loot." They lock weapons.
As you coast through the nebula a pirate ship matches your course and closes the distance. Better to pick your battleground, but beggars can't be choosers.
A hostile vessel descends from out of the nebula. Combat stations!
You try to read the ID of a ship ahead in the fog, but it's too thick to penetrate. You have your answer when the ship turns, weapons hot!

event.name: NEBULA_ENCOUNTER_SUN
event.text: It seems that the nebula here has condensed into a newly born star. It's quite the spectacle... but also very deadly. A Slug vessel is admiring the star, but upon seeing you decides to attack instead!

event.name: NEBULA_STORM_BOARDING
event.text: You find two heavily damaged ships floating nearby, the remains of a battle. You begin to harvest some usable debris when you hear the sounds of someone beaming aboard followed by the shouts of a boarding party.
